001import java.util.HashMap;
002import java.util.Set;
003
004/**
005 * Class Room - Represents a location in the game.
006 * 
007 * A Room is a specific location in the game's map. Each room has a description
008 * and can be connected to other rooms in various directions.
009 * 
010 * 
011 * @author Florian NELCHA
012 */
013public class Room
014{
015    // ### Attributes ###
016    
017    private String aDescription;
018    private HashMap <String,Room> aExits;
019    private String aImageName;
020    private ItemList aItems;
021    
022    // ### Constructor ###
023    
024    /**
025     * Constructor to initialize the room with a description, an image, and two HashMaps with
026     * its exits and Items.
027     * 
028     * @param pD Description of the room.
029     * @param pI Location of the room's image.
030     */
031    public Room(final String pD, final String pI)
032    {
033        this.aDescription = pD;
034        this.aExits = new HashMap <String,Room>();
035        this.aImageName = pI;
036        this.aItems = new ItemList();
037    } // Room()
038    
039    // ### Getters ###
040    
041    /**
042     * Gets the description of the room.
043     * 
044     * @return Description of the room.
045     */
046    public String getDescription()
047    {
048        return this.aDescription;
049    } // getDescription()
050    
051    /**
052     * Gets the room in the specified direction if it exists.
053     * 
054     * @param  pDirection The direction in which to look for an exit.
055     * @return The neighboring room in the specified direction, or null
056     * if it doesn't exist.
057     */
058    public Room getExit(final String pDirection)
059    {
060        if (this.aExits.containsKey(pDirection))
061        {
062            return this.aExits.get(pDirection);
063        }
064        return null;
065    } // getExit()
066    
067    /**
068     * Creates a keySet of all the exits from the current room, then constructs
069     * a string of it.
070     * 
071     * @return A string with all available exit directions.
072     */
073    public String getExitString()
074    {
075        String vExitString = "Exits :";
076        Set<String> vKeys = this.aExits.keySet();
077        for(String vExit : vKeys) 
078        {
079            vExitString += " " + vExit;
080        }
081        
082        return vExitString;
083    } // getExitString()
084    
085    /**
086     * Returns a description of the current room, of the form : 
087     *      You are in the Control Room.
088     *      Exits : south
089     * 
090     * @return A description of the room, and its exits
091     */
092    public String getLongDescription()
093    {
094        return "You are " + this.aDescription + "\n" + getExitString() + "\n" + getItemString();
095    } // getLongDescription()
096    
097    /**
098     * Returns the name of the Room's image.
099     * 
100     * @return The name of the Room's image.
101     */
102    public String getImageName()
103    {
104         return this.aImageName;
105    } //getImageName()
106    
107    /**
108     * Returns the item having the specified name.
109     * 
110     * @param  pName The name of the item we look for.
111     * @return The item having the specified name.
112     */
113    public Item getItem(final String pName) 
114    {
115        return this.aItems.getItem(pName);
116    } //getItem()
117    
118    /**
119     * Creates a keySet of all the Items in the current room, then constructs
120     * a string of it.
121     * 
122     * @return A string with all available Items.
123     */
124    public String getItemString()
125    {
126        return "Items in the room : " + this.aItems.getItemString();
127    } //getItemString()
128    
129    // ### Setters ###
130    
131    /**
132     * Sets a new description for the room.
133     * 
134     * @param pNewD New description to set.
135     */
136    public void updateDescription(final String pNewD)
137    {
138        this.aDescription = pNewD;
139    } //updateDescription()
140    
141    /**
142     * Sets an exit for the specified direction to a neighboring room.
143     * 
144     * @param pDirection Direction of the exit.
145     * @param pNeighbor  The neighboring room in that direction.
146     */
147    public void setExits(final String pDirection, 
148                        final Room pNeighbor)
149    {
150        aExits.put(pDirection, pNeighbor);
151    } //setExits()
152    
153    /**
154     * Adds an Item in the room
155     * 
156     * @param pItem Item to add in the room.
157     */
158    public void addItem(final Item pItem)
159    {
160        this.aItems.addItem(pItem);
161    } //addItems()
162    
163    /**
164     * Remove the specified Item from the room
165     * 
166     * @param pItemName Name of the Item to remove from the room.
167     */
168    public void removeItem(final String pItemName)
169    {
170        this.aItems.removeItem(pItemName);
171    } //removeItem()
172    
173    // ### Other Methods ###
174    
175    /**
176     * Checks if the given room is one of the exits of this room.
177     * 
178     * @param pRoom The room to check.
179     * @return True if the room is an exit, false otherwise.
180     */
181    public boolean isExit(final Room pRoom)
182    {
183        return this.aExits.containsValue(pRoom);
184    } // isExit()
185} // Room
